parametrized_description: A scientist needs to determine the number of orange juice boxes and apple juice boxes to consume. Each orange juice box provides VitaminDOrange units of vitamin D and VitaminCOrange units of vitamin C. Each apple juice box provides VitaminDApple units of vitamin D and VitaminCApple units of vitamin C. The number of apple juice boxes must be at least PreferenceRatio times the number of orange juice boxes. The scientist must consume at least MinimumOrangeBoxes orange juice boxes. To prevent vitamin C overdose, the total vitamin C intake must not exceed MaxVitaminC. The objective is to maximize the total vitamin D intake.

VitaminDOrange.description: Amount of vitamin D in each box of orange juice

VitaminCOrange.description: Amount of vitamin C in each box of orange juice

VitaminDApple.description: Amount of vitamin D in each box of apple juice

VitaminCApple.description: Amount of vitamin C in each box of apple juice

PreferenceRatio.description: Minimum ratio of apple juice boxes to orange juice boxes

MinimumOrangeBoxes.description: Minimum number of orange juice boxes to be consumed

MaxVitaminC.description: Maximum allowed units of vitamin C intake

NumberOfAppleJuiceBoxes.description: The number of apple juice boxes

NumberOfOrangeJuiceBoxes.description: The number of orange juice boxes

constraints.description: The number of apple juice boxes must be at least PreferenceRatio times the number of orange juice boxes.
The scientist must consume at least MinimumOrangeBoxes orange juice boxes.
The total vitamin C intake from orange and apple juice boxes must not exceed MaxVitaminC.

objective.description: Total vitamin D intake is the sum of the vitamin D provided by orange juice boxes and the vitamin D provided by apple juice boxes. The objective is to maximize the total vitamin D intake.
